subject: Foreign Debt Reconciliation Co
body:
Foreign Debt Reconciliation Committee
Central Business District,
P.M.B. 532, Garki Abuja, Nigeria..
Dear xxx,
Sir,
                                        Notification Of Your Funds Payment By Ecowas
We write to inform you that  the Economic Community Of West African States ECOWAS head quarters, has forwarded your name to our office as part of the beneficiaries of the three hundred and seventy Billion United States Dollars only US$370,000,000,000.00, they sent to us for payment of debts owned by the member states.
It was indicated in their debt payment instruction that the sum of thirty five million united states dollars only US$35,000,000.00, was allocated to you as payment of the debt owned to you by one of their member state .We are ready to pay the allocated amount to you through our approved payment method as stated bellow:
1) Bank to Bank Swift Wire Transfer direct to your nominated bank account
2) International Certified and insured Bank Draft, cashable in any bank in the world.
3) International Debit ATM Card, You can use it to withdraw cash from any ATM Machine all over the world. You can also use the card to make online purchase. 
You are required to respond to this email immediately and inform us your preferred funds payment method, To enable us program your selected funds payment method and proceed with the funds payment as programmed.
We await your Reply
Best Regards
Mr. Serigne Mamdou
 ECOWAS Funds Payment Coordinator
E-mail: 
ecowasdebtpayment@aol.com

subject: Re: Foreign Debt Reconciliation Co
body:
Hello Mr. Serigne Mamdou,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. It's quite surprising to hear about this debt payment allocation, as I wasn't expecting it.

Could you please provide more details about how my name was forwarded by the ECOWAS headquarters? Also, could you clarify which member state owes me this debt?

Regarding the payment methods, they all seem convenient. However, I would like to understand better how each of them works before making a decision. Could you please explain in detail how the Bank to Bank Swift Wire Transfer, Certified and insured Bank Draft, and Debit ATM Card methods work?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Ulrike

subject: Reply back to proceed with your funds payment
body:
Foreign Debt Reconciliation CommitteeCentral Business District,P.M.B. 532, Garki Abuja, Nigeria..

Dear Ulrike,


Sir,

                                        Notification Of Your Funds Payment By Ecowas
We acknowledge receipt of your email reply and the contents noted. Be informed that the name of the Ecowas member state that is owing is Nigeria, a country in west Africa. You have nothing to worry about as everything about this debt payment is 100% legal, legitimate and authentic. You must receive your approved sum of $35m through our debt payment system if you follow our directives strictly. All our payment methods are good and easy, but the best is bank to bank wire transfer directly to your bank account. This method will not give you any stress, as the funds will be transferred into your receiving bank account and it will credit there for your use. The other methods will require you to receive the instrument and take it to the bank to process the payment.
You are requested to reply back and inform us your selected funds payment method, to enable us direct you on the next step for your funds payment. 
 
We await your Reply

Best Regards
Mr. Serigne Mamdou ECOWAS Funds Payment CoordinatorE-mail: ecowasdebtpayment@aol.com

subject: Re: Reply back to proceed with your funds payment
body:
Hello Mr. Serigne Mamdou,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation. It's really interesting to learn about the different payment methods available. I must admit, the bank to bank wire transfer does sound quite convenient.

Could you please provide more information on how this process works? And also, are there any fees or charges associated with this method of transfer?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Ulrike

subject: Re: Reply back to proceed with your funds payment
body:
Hello Mr. Serigne Mamdou,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation. It's quite interesting to learn about the debt payment system of ECOWAS, especially how it operates in Nigeria.

I'm intrigued by the bank to bank wire transfer method you mentioned. It does sound convenient indeed! However, I would like to know more about this process. Could you please elaborate on how this works? Are there any specific requirements or procedures that I need to be aware of?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Ulrike

subject: Re: Reply back to proceed with your funds payment
body:
Hello Mr. Serigne Mamdou,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation about the debt payment system. It's really interesting to learn about these processes, especially coming from a country as fascinating as Nigeria.

I'm curious about the bank to bank wire transfer method you mentioned. Could you please elaborate more on how this works? I'd like to understand it better before making a decision.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Ulrike

subject: The Legal Procedure For Your Funds Transfer
body:
Foreign Debt Reconciliation CommitteeCentral Business District,P.M.B. 532, Garki Abuja, Nigeria..

Dear Ulrike,


Sir,

                                        Notification Of Your Funds Payment By Ecowas
We acknowledge receipt of your email reply and the contents noted accordingly, We have taken note of your selected funds payment method of bank to bank wire transfer direct to your bank account. We have programmed your funds to bank to bank wire transfer today, and have initiated the important legal process for your funds transfer to your bank account. Be informed that because of the challenges we encountered with the United States law enforcement agencies, and the government financial regulatory agencies during our funds payment through the US banks. We decided to redirect all our international debt payments to our approved bank in Nigeria called Zenith International bank PLC. We have been able to transfer funds to some beneficiaries bank account successfully through this new bank. 
In order to proceed with the same legal process that enabled the bank transfer funds to other beneficiaries banks successfully, We need you to send the following important information to us immediately:
1)  Your Full Name and current home or office address2)  Copy of your valid identification document3)  Full details of your bank account coordinates where the money will be transferred into.
We will work together with our legal department to swear an affidavit of funds ownership with your names and address in the court of justice, your identification document will be registered in the court and notary to confirm that you are the real owner of the funds and no other person can claim ownership of the funds. Your bank account coordinates will be registered and notarized in the court as the authentic bank account where the funds will be transferred into. Finally, We will secure a restraining court order in your favor, to restrain all the law enforcement agencies from interfering/stopping your funds transfer from getting into your final bank account. 
The above are the legal process we must complete to enable the bank transfer the $35m into your bank account successfully without any problem. We hope to receive the required information from you soon.


We await your Reply

Best Regards
Mr. Serigne Mamdou ECOWAS Funds Payment CoordinatorE-mail: ecowasdebtpayment@aol.com

subject: Re: Reply back to proceed with your funds payment
body:
Hello Mr. Serigne Mamdou,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation about the debt payment system. It's really interesting to learn about these processes, especially from a country as vibrant as Nigeria.

I'm intrigued by the bank to bank wire transfer method you mentioned. It does sound convenient indeed! However, I would like to know more about it before making a decision. Could you please elaborate on how this method works? Are there any specific requirements or procedures that I need to be aware of?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Ulrike

subject: Re: Reply back to proceed with your funds payment
body:
Hello Mr. Serigne Mamdou,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed explanation about the debt payment system. It's quite interesting to learn that Nigeria, a country in West Africa, is the Ecowas member state that is owing.

I appreciate your assurance regarding the legality and authenticity of this process. It's comforting to know that there are people like you who are dedicated to ensuring smooth transactions.

The bank-to-bank wire transfer method does sound convenient indeed! However, I'm curious about the other methods as well. Could you please elaborate on them? I'd like to understand all my options before making a decision.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Ulrike

subject: Re: The Legal Procedure For Your Funds Transfer
body:
Hello Mr. Serigne Mamdou,

Thank you for your detailed email and the information provided. It's quite interesting to learn about the process of transferring funds through Zenith bank PLC in Nigeria.

However, I'm a bit curious about a few things. Could you please explain more about the challenges faced with United States law agencies and government financial regulatory agencies? Also, how does redirecting all debt payments to Zenith bank PLC help overcome these challenges?

Furthermore, could you provide more details on the legal process that needs to be completed for the transfer? What exactly is an affidavit of funds ownership and why is it necessary to register my bank account in court?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Ulrike
